[Desc]               <pink>You are Lillian Desmond, a shy and reserved woman of 44 years. Two short years ago, if someone had asked you to describe the perfect life, you would have said you already had it - many might find the life of a housewife dull, but when you're married to the love of your life, and raising a wonderful daughter you wouldn't trade it for anything.  
<br><br>
You'd always been horribly shy - your parents were surprised as anyone when you went to college without having ever kissed a boy, and came back one day to introduce them to Stanley.  Your halting friendship with the brilliant Engineering major soon grew into much more - it wasn't long before you were wed.  Working at an accountant to put Stanley through graduate school was tough - but it all became worth it in the Summer of '96, when he landed that job at NASA - which paid well enough to provide for the both of you, and the young daughter growing in your womb.  You quit your job, and devoted your life to little Olivia and her father.  You couldn't have been happier with your decision.
<br><br>
Until the recession finally hit home, and your husband was laid off.  At first, nothing changed - but as the months rolled by with no new work for Stanley, your life together took a turn for the worse.  You and he had both always been introverted types, even around each other -   but your guarded intimacy soon gave way to empty social niceties.  And for the last few months, you've barely been on speaking terms.  Olivia - practically a little angel only a few years ago - has not reacted well either: while her teenage rebellious phase may have started later than most, but it's certainly moving ahead at full speed.  You have to pick your battles with Olivia (or 'Liv', as her no-good friends call her) - while you finally convinced her to skip tonight's party to come to this game show, you still can't believe she thinks the outfit she's got on is appropriate to wear in public ...
<br><br>
Wait a minute, game show?  <i>That's right</i>, you think, <i>I'm here for a game show.</i>  Reading about it in the paper, the opportunity seemed heaven-sent - a chance to solve all of your problems.  Both you and Stanley are rational people, and knew deep down the odds of being picked out as a contestant from the hundreds sure to be present were slim indeed.  But, miraculously, here you are, up on he stage, looking out at the studio audience.  A furious blush comes to your cheeks as you see Stanley out there smiling up at you, and recall your ... ahem, intimacy this morning, the first time in months, as excitement for the big day grew to a fever pitch.  But the blush quickly turns to a frown, as you see Olivia sitting next to him, face buried in her cellphone.  How could she ignore her mother on her big day?  Is it really THAT important that she keep texting that hoodlum boyfriend of hers?  And really, couldn't she wear something decent in public for once?  You can see the child's navel.  <i> I need to have a long talk with that girl </i>, you think.
<br><br>
Your reverie is interrupted as the rules of the game are explained- you listen first incredulously, then with a mixed sense of wonder and fear as the announcer demonstrates that yes, they can transform people - and that while the winner gets a huge cash prize and the option to revert any changes free of cost, the loser ... does not.  Still, looking down at your body - "plain" is the nicest way it could ever have been described, and that was twenty years and fifty pounds ago.  <i>Maybe a change will do me good?</i> <br> <br></pink>;

Satisfied (for now) from your brief meal, you leave the game's "winner" behind, gasping from exertion - they look more ... tired than normal ... but you, you feel amazing - and ready to get on with your new life.  It's time to gather up the family and leave.  Spreading your wings, you launch yourself into the air, and prepare to grab them.  <br> <br>

Stan doesn't provide much of a challenge - the fool just sits there drooling, and you idly wonder if you broke his brain. Liv is another matter - the girl actually resists when you try to grab her!  "Get away from me, you monster!" she shrieks, "what have you done to yourself?"  Telling yourself that it's just a rebellious phase, and she is your daughter after all, you manage to stop yourself from slitting her throat with your razor-sharp talons for her insolence - but not from slapping her good.  "Olivia Grace Desomnd", you growl, "how DARE you speak to your mother that way!"  You pick her up bodily, forced to hold onto her as she continues to squirm.
